segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 22
segments.en: Linked Discourses 22

segments.pli: 12. Dhammakathikavagga
segments.en: 12. A Dhamma speaker

segments.pli: 123. Sutavantasutta
segments.en: 123. Educated

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca sāriputto āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhiko bārāṇasiyaṃ viharanti isipatane migadāye.
segments.en: At one time Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita were staying near Benares, in the deer park at Isipatana.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā mahākoṭṭhiko sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yenāyasmā sāriputto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā … pe … etadavoca:
segments.en: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita came out of retreat, went to Venerable Sāriputta, bowed, sat down to one side, and said:

segments.pli: “Sutavatāvuso sāriputta, bhikkhunā katame dhammā yoniso manasi kātabbā”ti?
segments.en: “Reverend Sāriputta, what things should an educated mendicant properly attend to?”

segments.pli: “Sutavatāvuso koṭṭhika, bhikkhunā pañcupādānakkhandhā aniccato … pe … anattato yoniso manasi kātabbā.
segments.en: “An educated mendicant should properly attend to these five grasping aggregates as impermanent … as not-self.

segments.pli: Katame pañca?
segments.en: What five?

segments.pli: Seyyathidaṃ—rūpupādānakkhandho … pe … viññāṇupādānakkhandho.
segments.en: That is, the grasping aggregates of form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.

segments.pli: Sutavatāvuso koṭṭhika, bhikkhunā ime pañcupādānakkhandhā aniccato … pe … anattato yoniso manasi kātabbā.
segments.en: An educated mendicant should properly attend to these five grasping aggregates as impermanent … as not-self.

segments.pli: Ṭhānaṃ kho panetaṃ, āvuso, vijjati—yaṃ sutavā bhikkhu ime pañcupādānakkhandhe aniccato … pe … anattato yoniso manasi karonto sotāpattiphalaṃ sacchikareyyā”ti.
segments.en: It’s possible that an educated mendicant who regards the five grasping aggregates in this way will realize the fruit of stream-entry.”

segments.pli: “Sotāpannena panāvuso sāriputta, bhikkhunā katame dhammā yoniso manasi kātabbā”ti?
segments.en: “But Reverend Sāriputta, what things should a mendicant stream-enterer properly attend to?”

segments.pli: “Sotāpannenapi kho āvuso koṭṭhika, bhikkhunā ime pañcupādānakkhandhā aniccato … pe … anattato yoniso manasi kātabbā.
segments.en: “A mendicant stream-enterer should properly attend to these five grasping aggregates as impermanent … as not-self.

segments.pli: Ṭhānaṃ kho panetaṃ, āvuso, vijjati—yaṃ sotāpanno bhikkhu ime pañcupādānakkhandhe aniccato … pe … anattato yoniso manasi karonto sakadāgāmiphalaṃ … pe …
segments.en: It’s possible that a mendicant stream-enterer who regards the five grasping aggregates in this way will realize the fruit of once-return.” …

segments.pli: anāgāmiphalaṃ … pe …
segments.en: “It’s possible that a mendicant once-returner who regards the five grasping aggregates in this way will realize the fruit of non-return.” …

segments.pli: arahattaphalaṃ sacchikareyyā”ti.
segments.en: “It’s possible that a mendicant non-returner who regards the five grasping aggregates in this way will realize the fruit of perfection.” …

segments.pli: “Arahatā panāvuso sāriputta, katame dhammā yoniso manasi kātabbā”ti?
segments.en: “But Reverend Sāriputta, what things should a perfected one properly attend to?”

segments.pli: “Arahatāpi khvāvuso koṭṭhika, ime pañcupādānakkhandhā aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato yoniso manasi kātabbā.
segments.en: “Reverend Koṭṭhita, a perfected one should properly attend to the five grasping aggregates as impermanent, as suffering, as diseased, as an abscess, as a dart, as misery, as an affliction, as alien, as falling apart, as empty, as not-self.

segments.pli: Natthi, khvāvuso, arahato uttari karaṇīyaṃ, katassa vā paticayo;
segments.en: A perfected one has nothing more to do, and nothing that needs improvement.

segments.pli: api ca kho ime dhammā bhāvitā bahulīkatā diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārāya ceva saṃvattanti satisampajaññāya cā”ti.
segments.en: Still, these things, when developed and cultivated, lead to blissful meditation in the present life, and also to mindfulness and situational awareness.”

segments.pli: Ekādasamaṃ.

sections.title: At one time Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita were…

suttaplex.blurb: Mahākoṭṭhita asks what an educated mendicant should focus on, and Sāriputta replies that if they focus on aggregates as impermanent, etc. they may become a stream-enterer. A stream-enterer contemplating in the same way may become a non-returner, a once-returner, and a perfected one.
